Name: 24_harvest_batch_sow_batches
Representative_Docs: ['fix sow allocation fix the way that sow tasks allocate memory previously sow tasks used a very simplistic allocation and helper script launching strategy it would allocate one chunk of memory for the grow scripts and one chunk for the weaken scripts this minimizes the chunk size and means that we can fit sow helper scripts into more fragmented ram however it also means that one of these two allocations could fail if the other is too large or worse they could be out of balance if one allocation gets shrunk and the other doesn t in addition because the two batches of scripts were launched without any delays the grow script would finish significantly before the weaken scripts looking a bit strange on the monitor depending on how long the gap is to fix this we ve changed the sow script to calculate batches similar to how harvest works this makes the minimum allocation chunk a balanced group of threads and the timing logic is reused from the harvest batches so the timing of batch endings is precise this opens the door to a minor optimization in how sow evolves since each batch is potentially smaller we don t get as much exponential grow bonus from larger thread counts so instead we stagger batch spawns so they end serially and each grow batch gets to multiply the effect of the previous ones it remains to be seen if this will actually end up speeding up the growing process but it seems like it s better than using smaller batches that spawn as quickly as possible and then end in a somewhat unpredictable order', 'batch change harvest to use growable allocations change harvest to match till and sow task scripts in using the new growable allocations this should cause all existing tasks to be prioritized for growth when new memory becomes available rather than the task selector greedily assigning new memory to new tasks there is one complication though because harvest creates a pipeline of batches that it continuously spawns as the old ones end adding new memory is not sufficient to get the harvest script to make use of it we need to explicitly extend the length of the pipeline and spawn batches until we ve filled the new allocation size with batches then we should return to the process of waiting for batches to end before spawning a replacement batch', 'growable tasks transition the three main tasks in the batch hacking system to using create new helper apis for use by both sow and harvest scripts to calculate phase ordering and spawn batches of multiple script types we significantly reworked how sow works changing from two allocations one for weaken threads one for grow threads to one allocation increased the chunk size to a balanced set of grow weaken threads 12 1 also made some other miscellaneous improvements to the batch hacking system to facilitate usage of the growable allocations like adding launch failure tracking and exponential backoff for the task selector task launching wrap the done port sending in an callback to avoid delaying exit of weaken script implementing harvest script releasing chunks as hacking level rises and max overlap needed reduces corrected the implementation of to adjust the so remaining issue is that we don t cancel or shrink harvest jobs when much more valuable servers become available some sort of periodic rebalancing of tasks is probably necessary']
